Package depgraph.ImageRenderer

Class ImageRenderer

java.lang.Object
depgraph.ImageRenderer.ImageRenderer
public class ImageRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
Relatively simple class. It takes a format and output file name and and creates and runs a process based off a run string generated by this class (see createRunString).

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.lang.String[] OUTPUT_TYPES
    List of supported image types that dot can generate.
    private java.lang.Process process
    Used to keep track of the command line process until it has finished executing.
    private java.lang.Runtime runtime
    Runtime instace.

    No-arg constructor.

  • Field Details

    • runtime

      private java.lang.Runtime runtime
      Runtime instace. Used to execute programs.

    • process

      private java.lang.Process process
      Used to keep track of the command line process until it has finished executing.

    • OUTPUT_TYPES

      public final java.lang.String[] OUTPUT_TYPES
      List of supported image types that dot can generate. See dot(1)

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageRenderer

      public ImageRenderer()
      No-arg constructor. Initializes the runtime instance.

  • Method Details

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage()
      Default render option. Renders the graph as a PDF called "out.pdf".

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Renders the graph as a pdf with the specified file name.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the output file.

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage​(java.lang.String format, java.lang.String fileName)
      Renders the graph image by creating a dot run string. Specifies the type and output file name.
      Parameters:
      format - Format the image should be generated as.
      fileName - Name of the output file.

    • getFormatFromFileExtension

      private java.lang.String getFormatFromFileExtension​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks if the file extension specified in the output file name is a valid by checking if it exists in the OUTPUT_TYPES class attribute.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the output file.
      Returns:
      The type of image to render. See OUTPUT_TYPES and dot(1) for details.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If the specified format is invalid.

    • createRunString

      private java.lang.String createRunString​(java.lang.String format, java.lang.String fileName)
      Creates a run string from the format of the image and nmae of the output file.
      Parameters:
      format - Image format.
      fileName - Output file name.
      Returns:
      Valid run string to create a process from.
